intro: Conothamnus aureus, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with narrow, leathery leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences and are pollinated by birds and insects. Conothamnus aureus is also a symbol of Australia and is widely cultivated for its ornamental value.
